summary:
The UN headquarters is in New York City, on the East River. It was built in 1952 and designed by famous architects like Wallace Harrison and Le Corbusier. The complex includes important buildings like the Secretariat and General Assembly.

This place is like the main office for the UN, where leaders meet and make decisions. It's on land that's not officially part of the U.S., but the UN follows most of the country's rules. Other UN offices are in Geneva, Vienna, and Nairobi, helping with different tasks.
title: Headquarters of the United Nations
